   Adam Putnam
   stated on May 4, 2010 in a campaign statement:
   Scott Maddox has run "losing campaigns for 3 of Florida's 4 available
   cabinet positions."

"As a result of his multiple losing
   campaigns for 3 of Florida’s 4 available Cabinet positions, Scott Maddox
   has confused job descriptions for the one he’s running for this time.

Maddox endorsed U.S. Rep. Jim Davis of Tampa, who won
   the party's nomination but went on to lose that November to
   then-Republican Charlie Crist.

In trying to cast Maddox as a politician who will run for anything he
   think he might win, the Putnam campaign said Maddox has run "losing
   campaigns for 3 of Florida's 4 available Cabinet positions."
